title: Man is filmed holding onto a fridge at the back of a Bunnings rental ute in Wagga Wagga
text:
Moving homes can be expensive and the added cost of paying for a removalist can send bank balances plunging into the red.

One man decided to save his hard-earned dollars and use a Bunnings rental ute to move his furniture while clinging onto his belongings for dear life.

The man could be see clutching his fridge in the back of the ute while it travelled down Sturt Highway in Wagga Wagga, southern NSW, on Monday.

The ute was also filled with a mattress and a bar stool.

The footage was captioned reading 'This is Wagga' and 'Midday Adventures'.

The Traffic and Highway Patrol NSW Command Force Facebook page captioned the post 'Loadfail @ Wagga Wagga'.

The footage of a man holding onto a fridge at the back of the ute was captioned reading 'This is Wagga' and 'Midday Adventures'

The photo uploaded on Facebook has since gained over 1,200 reactions and nearly 700 comments.

'New residents to Australia unaware of our rules. I bet this is perfectly normal in their country,' one wrote.

'Maybe the fridge was full of beer and why isn't he sitting in the comfy chair?' another wrote.

One added: 'Maybe he's part of the furniture.'

A spokesman from NSW Police told Daily Mail Australia the investigation in ongoing.
description: Snapchat footage of the incident on the Sturt Highway in Wagga Wagga, southern NSW, was uploaded on social media on Monday.
authors: Paula Ahillon For Daily Mail Australia
